decks.notes: This Jeskai Aggro deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient creatures to apply constant pressure on the opponent. By combining aggressive creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Marauding Mako with spells like Fear of Missing Out and Torch the Tower, the deck aims to quickly establish board dominance and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of disruptive elements like Spyglass Siren and Tersa Lightshatter helps to control the board while maintaining the aggressive tempo. The versatile spell suite and mana base allow for flexibility in adapting to different matchups and situations.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board with removal spells and countermagic while drawing cards and generating incremental advantages. It aims to stabilize the game in the early turns and then overpower the opponent with powerful late-game threats like Roiling Dragonstorm and Marang River Regent. It also includes a mix of land cards to ensure mana consistency and allows for flexibility in its game plan. By effectively disrupting the opponent's game plan and generating card advantage, the deck looks to outvalue and outlast opponents in a slower, grindy matchup.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana production through cards like Abuelo's Awakening and Stock Up to cast the powerful Omniscience and Roiling Dragonstorm. By using Omniscience, players can then cast multiple spells for free, including Moment of Truth and Temporary Lockdown to control the board and deal damage. The deck also includes ways to protect the combo pieces with countermagic like Spell Pierce and Confounding Riddle. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo finish that they can't easily deal with.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter to deal damage quickly. Spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage can help to remove threats or further pump up creatures. The deck also includes card draw and selection cards like Opt and Sleight of Hand to maintain consistency. Overall, the goal is to play aggressively, dealing damage early and often to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while providing consistency.

The key concept of this Jeskai Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By utilizing a mix of powerful creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Steamcore Scholar, along with spells like Torch the Tower and Spell Pierce, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and close out the game quickly. The deck also includes card draw and protection spells to maintain momentum and ensure a steady stream of threats. With a strong mana base and versatile card choices, this deck is designed for quick, decisive victories in Standard 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck aims to utilize the combo between Omniscience and Roiling Dragonstorm to quickly bring out powerful dragons and overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes cards like Moment of Truth and Stock Up to generate card advantage and enable the combo. The inclusion of Temporary Lockdown and Ephara's Dispersal provides disruption against the opponent's strategies while also protecting the combo pieces. The deck also includes some additional utility cards like Spell Pierce and Blast Zone to further control the game state. Ultimately, the goal is to establish a dominant board presence and quickly finish off the opponent.

The deck is built around the combo of casting Omniscience and then using various spells like Roiling Dragonstorm, Moment of Truth, and Abuelo's Awakening to generate a powerful board state and secure victory. The goal is to ramp up mana quickly with Floodfarm Verge and Meticulous Archive, protect the combo with Temporary Lockdown and Ephara's Dispersal, and disrupt the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Spell Pierce and Refute. Marang River Regent provides additional pressure, while Thundertrap Trainer can help deal with problematic creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful, synergistic combo strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and efficient spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, combined with powerful spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of card draw spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand helps maintain card advantage and ensure a steady stream of threats. Riverpyre Verge and Shivan Reef provide mana fixing, while Stormchaser's Talent offers an additional source of damage. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and relentless in its attacks.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle using a combination of powerful creatures, disruptive spells, and burn spells. The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with creatures like Marauding Mako and Abhorrent Oculus, while also using spells like Torch the Tower and Spell Pierce to control the opponent's actions. The deck also includes card draw and reanimation options to maintain card advantage and consistency throughout the game. Additionally, the mana base is optimized to ensure smooth and efficient casting of spells.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain a fast and aggressive playstyle by utilizing low-cost creatures with pump spells and cheap removal to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck is built around the synergy between creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, and spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage. The deck also includes card draw and scrying effects to help maintain momentum and ensure consistency in draws. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of speed, efficiency, and synergy.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence with low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, while using spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to clear the way for attacks. Drake Hatcher and Slickshot Show-Off provide additional threats, while cards like Opt and Sleight of Hand help with card selection and maintaining a consistent hand. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient offensive strategy, utilizing a mix of creatures and spells to secure victory.

This deck focuses on aggressively attacking the opponent with low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce their life total. The key strategy is to continuously apply pressure on the opponent while using card draw and counter spells to maintain card advantage and protect your board. By efficiently utilizing the deck's mana base and synergies between creatures and spells, you can overwhelm your opponent and secure victory before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter while using cards like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to push through damage. The deck also includes spell manipulation and card draw with Opt, Sleight of Hand, and Stormchaser's Talent to maintain momentum. With a mix of cheap aggressive creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently. The mana base is designed to support the deck's tempo and aggressive strategy with a mix of Island, Mountain, and dual lands.

This deck focuses on using powerful control cards to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board control. It includes cards like Overlord of the Hauntwoods and Zur, Eternal Schemer to exert dominance over the game. Ride's End, Leyline Binding, and Temporary Lockdown are used to control the opponent's creatures and prevent them from mounting a strong offense. Up the Beanstalk provides ramp and card advantage, while cards like Elspeth's Smite and Day of Judgment serve as board wipes. The deck also includes various lands to ensure mana consistency and enable powerful plays.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and various control spells. By using cards like Overlord of the Hauntwoods and Zur, Eternal Schemer, the deck can establish board presence and control the tempo of the game. With cards like Ride's End and Leyline Binding, the deck can disrupt the opponent's strategy and stall the game until it can establish dominance. The deck also utilizes various lands to help fix its mana base and ensure it has the resources needed to execute its game plan effectively.

This deck focuses on a combination of aggression and disruption through the use of Dimir (Blue/Black) cards. The key strategy is to quickly play creatures like Spyglass Siren and Floodpits Drowner to apply pressure on the opponent while also using cards like Spell Pierce and Gix's Command to control the board. Kaito, Bane of Nightmares can generate advantage by exiling creatures, while Enduring Curiosity and Preacher of the Schism can provide card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions. It includes a mix of removal spells, counter spells, and card draw to manage the board and outvalue the opponent. The deck also includes a few powerful creatures like Marang River Regent and Shiko, Paragon of the Way to close out the game once control has been established. The mana base is designed to support the three-color requirements of the deck while ensuring consistency in casting spells.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on maintaining board control through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up its own resources to outlast the opponent in the late game. The deck includes a mix of creature threats, such as Marang River Regent and Shiko, Paragon of the Way, alongside powerful spells like Day of Judgment and Lightning Helix. With a careful balance of control elements and win conditions, this deck seeks to outmaneuver and overpower the opponent in a battle of attrition.

The deck aims to aggressively play creatures with evasion and disruptive spells to control the board and apply pressure to the opponent. Using a mix of efficient creatures and burn spells, the deck seeks to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats while also disrupting their game plan. The mana base is designed to support the deck's mana requirements while also providing flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around efficiently utilizing its resources to maintain pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay using a variety of low-cost creatures and removal spells to pressure the opponent. With strong creature cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Archfiend of the Dross, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and finish the game before they can mount a defense. Support cards like Duress and Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber help disrupt the opponent's strategy, while cards like Anoint with Affliction and Go for the Throat provide removal options to clear the way for attacks. The deck's goal is to establish board control early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. It combines low-cost creatures like Nurturing Pixie and Preacher of the Schism with high-impact creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells like Get Lost and Nowhere to Run to control the opponent's board. With a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells, this Orzhov Aggro deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

The focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. With a lineup of low-cost creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Hired Claw, supported by powerful spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage, the deck aims to quickly bring the opponent's life total to zero. Monastery Swiftspear and Tersa Lightshatter provide additional aggression, while cards like Screaming Nemesis and Witchstalker Frenzy offer resilience and staying power. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and relentless, putting pressure on the opponent from the start.

The main idea of this deck is to be aggressive and quick, utilizing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter to deal damage early on. Utilize spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to control the board and keep the pressure on your opponent. Slickshot Show-Off and Drake Hatcher provide additional value through their abilities. Opt, Into the Flood Maw, and Sleight of Hand help with card draw and filtering to maintain momentum. The mana base is focused on ensuring consistent access to both blue and red mana sources for casting spells efficiently.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly play and buff small creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, while using cheap spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to deal damage to the opponent. Opt and Sleight of Hand help you find the cards you need, while Stock Up and Stormchaser's Talent provide extra value. Riverpyre Verge and Shivan Reef help with mana fixing, and Spirebluff Canal ensures you have the mana you need to cast your spells. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and finish off the opponent quickly.

The deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays, supported by instant and sorcery spells to deal damage and control the board. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, combined with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Torch the Tower, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of card draw spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand ensures consistency in drawing the necessary cards to maintain pressure. Riverpyre Verge and Shivan Reef provide the necessary mana fixing for the red and blue spells in the deck.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes spells like Monstrous Rage and Burst Lightning to further enhance the damage output. The deck aims to apply pressure early in the game while maintaining card advantage through spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand. With a good mix of creatures and spells, this UR aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent by quickly deploying creatures and using burn spells to deal damage. The key strategy involves using cheap instants and sorceries to trigger prowess abilities and pump up creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter. Additionally, the deck aims to maintain card advantage with spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand while carefully managing resources to secure victory before the opponent can stabilize. The mana base is optimized for fast and consistent casting of spells to keep the aggression high.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with quick, aggressive creatures and efficient spells. Monastery Swiftspear, Cori-Steel Cutter, and Drake Hatcher provide early pressure, while cards like Monstrous Rage and Burst Lightning help push through damage and control the battlefield. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. The mix of creatures and spells allows for flexibility in both combat and burn damage, making it a versatile and dangerous deck to face in a Standard 1 vs 1 format.

This UR aggro deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter provide early aggression, while Slickshot Show-Off and Monstrous Rage enhance their damage potential. Opt, Sleight of Hand, and Stock Up help with card selection and maintaining tempo. Burst Lightning and Into the Flood Maw offer removal and direct damage options. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing the deck's synergy and efficient card choices to secure victory before the opponent can stabilize.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent and control the battlefield. By constantly pressuring the opponent with aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, while also using spells like Burst Lightning and Stormchaser's Talent to remove threats, the deck aims to overpower the opponent before they can set up their own game plan. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation to ensure a consistent flow of threats and answers throughout the game.

The focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and instant spells. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Slickshot Show-Off, combined with burn spells such as Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Card draw and selection from Opt, Sleight of Hand, and Stock Up help to ensure consistent aggression, while counterspells like Spell Pierce provide protection against opposing threats. The mana base is optimized for casting spells efficiently and consistently.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, creature removal, and card advantage. By utilizing spells like Day of Judgment and Leyline Binding, along with powerful creatures like Overlord of the Hauntwoods and Zur, Eternal Schemer, the deck aims to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. The land base is also built to support the control aspect, with a focus on utility lands like Hedge Maze and Floodfarm Verge. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions.

The main focus of this deck is to effectively control the game by disrupting your opponent's strategy, clearing the board with cards like Day of Judgment, and locking down their options with spells like Get Lost and Temporary Lockdown. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Overlord of the Hauntwoods and Zur, Eternal Schemer to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent. With a mix of removal, disruption, and strong creatures, this deck aims to outlast and outwit opponents in a 1 vs 1 Standard format game.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions and board state through a combination of removal spells and creature lockdown effects. By utilizing cards like "Day of Judgment" and "Temporary Lockdown," the player can clear the battlefield and prevent their opponent from developing a strong presence. Creatures like "Overlord of the Hauntwoods" and "Zur, Eternal Schemer" provide additional control options and threats for the opponent to deal with. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure the player can consistently access their spells and activate their abilities.

The main concept of this Dimir Aggro deck is to control the board with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Duress and Spell Pierce. The deck also focuses on aggression with creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Spyglass Siren, aiming to close out the game quickly. Additionally, the deck has some card advantage and recursion tools with Enduring Curiosity and Anoint with Affliction. It aims to have a strong early game presence and maintain pressure on the opponent throughout the match.

This Esper Aggro deck focuses on quickly assembling a board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Fear of Isolation and Nowhere to Run. By utilizing cards like Nurturing Pixie and Sunpearl Kirin, the deck can apply pressure early on and maintain momentum with cards like Stormchaser's Talent. With a mix of creatures and disruptive spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game before they can stabilize. The land base is designed to provide consistent mana sources to support the aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and powerful direct damage spells. The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Hired Claw to quickly build a threatening board presence, while also using burst damage spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to quickly finish off the opponent. Surrak, Elusive Hunter provides additional threat and evasion, while cards like Snakeskin Veil and Witchstalker Frenzy help protect your creatures and push through damage. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive nature of the deck with a focus on red and green sources.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes a mix of versatile spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up resources through card draw and ramp. The deck aims to maintain board control through efficient removal and counters, while eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful late-game threats like Marang River Regent and Shiko, Paragon of the Way. The mana base is designed to support the three-color Jeskai control archetype, providing consistency in casting spells of all colors.

The main focus of this Jeskai Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw. By using cards like Day of Judgment, Lightning Helix, and Temporary Lockdown, the deck aims to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also features powerful finishers like Marang River Regent and Shiko, Paragon of the Way to close out the game once the opponent has been sufficiently controlled. The mana base includes a variety of dual lands to ensure smooth mana production for the three-color deck.

The deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures and controlling the board with spells like Torch the Tower and Spell Pierce. It aims to maintain tempo and aggression through card draw with Profit's Eidetic Memory and Fear of Missing Out. The mana base allows for a consistent and efficient curve, with a mix of lands supporting the three colors of the Jeskai color combination. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with early threats and disruptive spells while maintaining card advantage and board control.

The main concept of this Jeskai Aggro deck is to overwhelm your opponent quickly with a mix of efficient creatures and powerful spells. Utilize cards like Abhorrent Oculus and Marauding Mako to pressure your opponent early on, while using cards like Profit's Eidetic Memory and Torch the Tower to control the board and maintain tempo. The deck also includes some card advantage options like Fear of Missing Out and Sheltered by Ghosts to help fuel your aggression. Overall, this deck aims to be fast, aggressive, and versatile in order to outpace and outmatch your opponent.

The deck is focused on aggressive play, utilizing a combination of low-cost creatures and spells to quickly put pressure on the opponent. By including cards like Abhorrent Oculus, Marauding Mako, and Steamcore Scholar, the deck aims to control the board early on while dealing consistent damage. Fear of Missing Out and Torch the Tower provide additional removal options, while Helping Hand and Proft's Eidetic Memory offer card advantage. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disruption, leveraging its Jeskai color identity for versatility and reach.

The key concept of this Mardu Aggro deck is to create an aggressive and fast-paced strategy, utilizing a combination of low-cost creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By maintaining a high tempo and applying constant pressure, the deck aims to control the board and deal significant damage to the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, the deck includes cards that provide additional benefits or resources to keep the aggression going, ensuring that the opponent is always on the back foot. The focus is on a proactive and efficient strategy to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive mono black creatures and removal spells. By controlling the battlefield with cards like Go for the Throat and Sheoldred's Edict, the player aims to consistently apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The creatures in the deck are designed to be efficient and powerful, allowing for a fast and relentless assault on the opponent. The deck's focus on speed and aggression makes it a formidable force in Standard 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo of Omniscience and Roiling Dragonstorm to quickly take control of the game. It includes cards to help search for key pieces of the combo, protect them from removal, and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Marang River Regent and Moment of Truth provide additional threats and card advantage, while Floodfarm Verge and Meticulous Archive help with mana fixing and card draw. The deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and overwhelming advantage through casting powerful spells for free with Omniscience.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Omniscience Combo, which allows you to play your spells for free. By using cards like Marang River Regent and Moment of Truth to generate mana and draw cards, along with support cards like Temporary Lockdown and Refute to control the game, you can set up a powerful board state and overwhelm your opponent. Additionally, cards like Roiling Dragonstorm and Thundertrap Trainer provide synergy with the combo to finish off your opponent quickly and efficiently.
